name: Love Hate
description:
There's a thin line between love and hate, and they share a lot in common. One thing for sure though; They look great sat on top of each other. Landscape 2 colour screen print, uniquly design for Fit for a Frame by Ryan Dean-Corke.

Details:

  • 2 colour screen print - Red and Blue inks
  • Paper stock - GF Smith Colorplan Mist 270GSM
  • Dimensions - 40cm x 30cm
  • Limited first edition - only 25 available

name: Not all those who wander
description:
Not all those who wander are lost' is a line borrowed from a poem by J. R. R. Tolkien. In the age of GPS and route planners it's always good to remind yourself that it's still ok to wander a little, and leave the maps for the followers.

2 colour, black and metallic copper screen print designed by UK based freelance designer Chris Henley.

Details:

  • 2 colour screen print - Metallic bronze and black inks
  • Paper stock - Mohawk Superfine 270GSM
  • Dimensions - 50cm x 70cm (B2)
  • 2nd edition - 50 available

name: Choice not chance
description:
Life throws up many obstacles and decisions and free-will is a luxury. The ability to make our own choices and paths in life means that we can decide our own fate rather than leaving everything to chance. Designed by West London based agency Two Times Elliott. Check them out - @twotimeselliott.

Details:

  • 2 colour screen print - Metallic old & bright red ink
  • Paper stock - GF Smith Colorplan Sapphire 270GSM
  • Dimensions - 50cm x 70cm (B2)
  • Limited first edition - only 20 available

name: I destroy my enemies
description:
I love this quote, super simple yet it always makes me do a double-take – it looks aggressive but its a really positive statement. Also helpful to be reminded that there's always a choice when deciding how to deal with jerks. Metallic gold ink screen-printed onto black stock. Designed by UK based designer Luke Tonge, art-director of Boat Magazine.

Details:

  • 1 colour screen print - Metallic gold ink
  • Paper stock - GF Smith Colorplan Ebony 270GSM
  • Dimensions - 50cm x 70cm (B2)
  • Limited first edition - only 20 available

name: The meaning of life
description:
Like most people I've spent a lot of my life wondering what the point of it is. I finally feel like I'm closer to knowing the answer, so I decided to put what I've learned on this print. Unfortunately the paper wasn't quite big enough, so you'll have to figure it out for yourself. But I guess that's the point? 2 colour screen print, designed by freelance illustrator and designer Lee Crutchley, who quite often draws words, but sometimes doesn't.

Details:

  • 2 colour screen print - Aqua and black inks
  • Paper stock - Mohawk Superfine 270GSM
  • Dimensions - 50cm x 70cm (B2)
  • Limited first edition - only 20 available

name: Function over form
description:
This print is based on a philosophy Ashley applies to his designs and believes it should be adhered to in order to achieve set goals through design. Function should always be prioritised over form and the function must not be sacrificed because of unnecessary embellishment.

1 colour screen print by Ashley O'Brien, a Birmingham-based graphic designer, who produces simple and relevant design and is inspired by music and fashion.

Details:

  • 1st edition.
    20 available.
  • 1 Colour
    Screen print
  • Dimensions:
    50cm x 70cm
  • GF Smith Colorplan Ebony Black 270gsm

name: The only truth is music
description:
I think the quote speaks for itself really - The fact that music is universal language that unites and divides, creates emotions and feelings beyond the material world. "I am a big fan of Kerouac and the 'Beat Generation', so it was nice to be able to mix this with my passion for typography."

2 colour, screen print designed by UK based designer Ian Caulkett.

Details:

  • 1st edition.
    20 available.
  • 2 Colour
    Screen print
  • Dimensions:
    50cm x 70cm
  • GF Smith Mowhawk 270gsm

name: Black Gold - Coffee print
description:
Oil might be the fuel of the world, but coffee is the delicious black gold which fuels the minds of the world. Besides, no one wants a hot cup of crude in the morning.

Screen printed using a highly concentrated mixture of instant coffee & espresso, these prints are varied and organic.

Because of the nature of the print, the colour, texture and consistency does vary between the the 30 printed, but that’s half the charm!

Unique design by Ryan Dean-Corke of Fit For a Frame.

See more photos here

Details:

  • Limited edition.
    30 available.
  • Screen printed
    with coffee.
  • Dimensions:
    30cm x 40cm
  • Ellie Poo stock 300gsm

name: A man without a moustache
description:
You like tea and you like moustaches. Man optional.

A typographic 3 colour screen print comprising of a cool grey with black font and accent tangerines. The organic design incorporates hand drawn illustrations and subtle textures within the background.

Lovingly produced by Birmingham based designer and illustrator Claire Hartley, curator of the Pointe Blank collective.

See more photos here

Details:

  • 1st edition.
    30 available.
  • 3 Colour
    Screen print
  • Dimensions:
    50cm x 70cm
  • GF Smith Mowhawk 270gsm

name: If you can't stand the heat
description:
A bit of tough love goes along way. A fun variation on the quote coined by US President Harry S. Truman "If you don't like the heat, get out of the kitchen". Ideal for an industrious design studio's walls.

This punchy and vibrant screen print is a mix of typography and half-tone style illustrative flourishes, giving it great fine details you'll want to see close up.

Designed by London based pixel & pantone pusher James Braithwaite, Creative Director of Substrakt.

See more photos here

Details:

  • 1st edition.
    30 available.
  • 2 Colour
    Screen print
  • Dimensions:
    50cm x 70cm
  • GF Smith Mowhawk 270gsm

name: Do what you love
description:
A slight variation on the original quote by Felix Sockwell, this is the reason this website was started. If you do what you love, and love what you do, you owe it to yourself to focus on what makes you happy, not necessarily money.

This is a very bright and vivid 2 colour screen print, which looks great framed (50x70 sizes) or not. It was designed by Ryan Dean-Corke, a user interface designer currently based in the English midlands. He's also the creator of Fit for a Frame and other projects.

See more photos here

Details:

  • 1st edition.
    30 available.
  • 2 Colour
    Screen print
  • Dimensions:
    50cm x 70cm
  • GF Smith Mowhawk 270gsm
